snippet: The report endorsed government efforts to fight terrorism but said the laws regulating them were “incomprehensible” and could erode public confidence.
abstract: Independent report by lawyer David Anderson calls for changes to Britain's surveillance laws, arguing that they are undemocratic and opaque.
lead_paragraph: The report endorsed government efforts to fight terrorism but said the laws regulating them were “incomprehensible” and could erode public confidence.

headline.main: Government Report Urges Changes in British Surveillance Law
headline.print_headline: Britain Is Urged to Fix ‘Intolerable’ Surveillance System
